segments.text: I see the boy on that stool, and I can’t help but smile at his determination.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so cute, just waiting for her share like a little partner in crime.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the woman is completely oblivious, and it’s kind of funny how focused she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, but she’s just drying that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the kids are going to get away with it, and that’s kind of exciting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, and it’s a shame she’s missing it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice the puddle or the kids stealing cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so close to tipping over, but he’s got such a serious look on his face.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is one of those moments that’ll be funny later, even if it’s messy now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light in here is so warm, and it makes everything feel cozy despite the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR
